hero.title: Access your devices' terminal from anywhere, via the web.
hero.subtitle: rtty is a reverse proxy that allows you to access your device's terminal via a web browser. It is lightweight, secure, and easy to deploy.

features.title: Why rtty?
features.subtitle: A suite of powerful features designed for performance and ease-of-use.

lightweight.title: 🚀 Lightweight & Fast
lightweight.desc: The client is written in C, ensuring minimal resource consumption on your embedded devices. The Go-based server is efficient and easy to deploy.

web_access.title: 🌐 Web-based Access
web_access.desc: Access your device's terminal from any modern web browser, anywhere in the world. No client software needed for access.

secure.title: 🔒 Secure by Default
secure.desc: Connections can be secured with SSL/TLS, protecting your data in transit. Device access can be controlled with unique IDs.

cross_platform.title: 🧩 Cross-Platform
cross_platform.desc: The client runs on various Linux-based systems, including embedded devices. The server can be deployed on any major OS.

file_transfer.title: 📁 File Transfer
file_transfer.desc: Easily transfer files to and from your remote device directly through the web interface using zmodem (lrzsz).

open_source.title: 👨‍💻 Open Source
open_source.desc: rtty is fully open-source and community-driven. Contribute on GitHub and help shape its future.
